title: Disease and Pest Control Systems for Ornamental Plants
description: Recognition, prevention and control of diseases, insect/mite pests and weeds that impact commercial ornamental plantings. Integrated pest management strategies presented including biological, cultural, and safe and proper pesticidal controls. Laboratory emphasizes monitoring, problem solving and application of appropriate pest control measures. 3 lectures, 1 laboratory.
prerequisites: BOT 323 or BOT 324, and HCS 120 and PPSC 311 and PPSC 321
